headline: Earth’s landmasses lost trillions of tons of water this century
context: Scientists link the sharp decline with an increase in global drought and sea level rise

A man walks across the dry bed of Lake Ahmad Sar in India in 2015. The total amount of water in Earth’s lakes, rivers and soils has drastically dropped since the turn of the century, a new study finds. The primary culprit: rising global temperatures.

annotations.paragraph: Earth’s landmasses are holding onto a lot less water than they used to — and this loss is not just due to melting ice sheets.
annotations.reason: This paragraph introduces the main topic of the article, which is the loss of water from Earth's landmasses.
